Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects5EnvIOa.name: EnvIO
Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects5EnvIOa.abstract: EnvIO is a data type to perform IO operations that produce errors of type E and values of type A, having access to an immutable environment of type D. It can be seen as a Kleisli function (D) -> IO<E, A>.

Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects10RIOPar.name: RIOPartial
Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects10RIOPar.abstract: Partial application of the EnvIO data type, omitting the last parameter.

Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects3RIOa.name: RIO
Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects3RIOa.abstract: A RIO is a data type like EnvIO with no explicit error type, resorting to the Error protocol to handle them.

Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects11URIOPa.name: URIOPartial
Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects11URIOPa.abstract: Partial application of the URIO data type, omitting the last parameter.

Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects4URIOa.name: URIO
Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects4URIOa.abstract: An URIO is a data type like EnvIO that never fails; i.e. it never produces errors.

Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects4Taska.name: Task
Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects4Taska.abstract: A Task is an IO with no explicit error type, resorting to the Error protocol to handle them.

Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects3UIOa.name: UIO
Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects3UIOa.abstract: An UIO is an IO operation that never fails; i.e. it never produces errors.

Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects5IORefa.name: IORef
Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects5IORefa.abstract: IORef is an asynchronous, concurrent, mutable reference backed by IO, holding a value of type A. Provides safe concurrent access and modification of its content.

Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects8EnvIORe.name: EnvIORef
Typealiases.html#/s:10BowEffects8EnvIORe.abstract: EnvIORef is an asynchronous, concurrent, mutable reference backed by EnvIO, holding a value of type A. Provides safe concurrent access and modification of its content.

Protocols/Index.html#/s:9BowOptics5Index.abstract: Pre-composes the AffineTraversal provided by this Index with an isomorphism.

Protocols/Index.html#/s:9BowOptics5Index.name: index(_:iso:)
Protocols/Index.html#/s:9BowOptics5Index.abstract: Post-composes the AffineTraversal provided by this Index with an isomorphism.

Protocols/FilterIndex.html#/s:9BowOptics.name: filter(_:)
Protocols/FilterIndex.html#/s:9BowOptics.abstract: Filters the foci of a Traversal with a predicate.

Protocols/FilterIndex.html#/s:9BowOptics.name: filter(_:iso:)
Protocols/FilterIndex.html#/s:9BowOptics.abstract: Pre-composes the Traversal provided by this FilterIndex with an isomorphism.

Protocols/FilterIndex.html#/s:9BowOptics.name: filter(_:iso:)
Protocols/FilterIndex.html#/s:9BowOptics.abstract: Post-composes the Traversal provided by the FilterIndex with an isomorphism.

Protocols/FilterIndex.html#/s:9BowOptics.name: filter(_:zipWithIndex:)
Protocols/FilterIndex.html#/s:9BowOptics.abstract: Provides a Traversal when this structure has an instance of Traverse.

Protocols/Each.html#/s:9BowOptics4EachP4.name: each
Protocols/Each.html#/s:9BowOptics4EachP4.abstract: Provides a Traversal for this structure with focus on EachFoci.

Protocols/Each.html#/s:9BowOptics4EachPA.name: each(_:)
Protocols/Each.html#/s:9BowOptics4EachPA.abstract: Pre-composes the provided Traversal from this Each with an isomorphism.

Protocols/Each.html#/s:9BowOptics4EachPA.name: each(_:)
Protocols/Each.html#/s:9BowOptics4EachPA.abstract: Post-composes the provided Traversal from this Each with an isomorphism.

Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsP4.name: cons
Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsP4.abstract: Provides a Prism between this structure and its first element and tail.

Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsPA.name: firstOption
Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsPA.abstract: Provides an AffineTraversal between this structure and its first element.

Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsPA.name: tailOption
Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsPA.abstract: Provides an AffineTraversal between this structure and its tail.

Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsPA.name: cons(_:)
Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsPA.abstract: Pre-composes the cons Prism with a given isomorphism.

Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsPA.name: cons(_:)
Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsPA.abstract: Post-composes the cons `Prismp with a given isomorphism.

Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsPA.name: prepend(_:)
Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsPA.abstract: Prepends an element at the left of this structure.

Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsPA.name: uncons
Protocols/Cons.html#/s:9BowOptics4ConsPA.abstract: Deconstructs this structure into an optional tuple of its first element and its tail.

Protocols/At.html#/s:9BowOptics2AtP2atyA.name: at(_:)
Protocols/At.html#/s:9BowOptics2AtP2atyA.abstract: Obtains a Lens for a structure of this type with focus in AtFoci at index AtIndex.

Protocols/At.html#/s:9BowOptics2AtPAAE6r.name: remove(_:)
Protocols/At.html#/s:9BowOptics2AtPAAE6r.abstract: Deletes a value associated with an index by setting it to Option.none

Protocols/At.html#/s:9BowOptics2AtPAAE6r.name: remove(_:)
Protocols/At.html#/s:9BowOptics2AtPAAE6r.abstract: Deletes a value associated with an index by setting it to nil.

Protocols/At.html#/s:9BowOptics2AtPAAE2a.name: at(_:iso:)
Protocols/At.html#/s:9BowOptics2AtPAAE2a.abstract: Post-composes the lens at a given index with an isomorphism.

Protocols/At.html#/s:9BowOptics2AtPAAE2a.name: at(_:iso:)
Protocols/At.html#/s:9BowOptics2AtPAAE2a.abstract: Pre-composes the lens at a given index with an isomorphism.

Protocols/AutoTraversal.html#/s:9BowOpti.name: traversal(for:)
Protocols/AutoTraversal.html#/s:9BowOpti.abstract: Provides a Traversal focused on the items of the field given by a key path.

Protocols/AutoTraversal.html#/s:9BowOpti.name: traversal(for:)
Protocols/AutoTraversal.html#/s:9BowOpti.abstract: Provides a Traversal focused on the items of the field given by a key path.

Protocols/AutoTraversal.html#/s:9BowOpti.name: traversal(for:)
Protocols/AutoTraversal.html#/s:9BowOpti.abstract: Provides a Traversal focused on the items of the field given by a key path.

Protocols/AutoSetter.html#/s:9BowOptics1.name: setter(for:)
Protocols/AutoSetter.html#/s:9BowOptics1.abstract: Generates a Setter for the provided field.

Protocols/AutoSetter.html#/s:9BowOptics1.name: boundSetter(for:onValue:)
Protocols/AutoSetter.html#/s:9BowOptics1.abstract: Generates a BoundSetter for the provided field on a specific value.

Protocols/AutoSetter.html#/s:9BowOptics1.name: boundSetter(for:)
Protocols/AutoSetter.html#/s:9BowOptics1.abstract: Generates a BoundSetter for the provided field on this value.

Protocols/AutoPrism.html#/s:9BowOptics9A.name: prism(for:)
Protocols/AutoPrism.html#/s:9BowOptics9A.abstract: Generates a prism for an enum case with no associated values.

Protocols/AutoPrism.html#/s:9BowOptics9A.name: prism(for:)
Protocols/AutoPrism.html#/s:9BowOptics9A.abstract: Generates a prism for an enum case with associated values.

Protocols/AutoOptics.html#/s:9BowOptics0.name: copy(with:for:)
Protocols/AutoOptics.html#/s:9BowOptics0.abstract: Creates a copy of this object, replacing the value at the given key path by the provided value.

Protocols/AutoLens.html#/s:9BowOptics8Au.name: lens(for:)
Protocols/AutoLens.html#/s:9BowOptics8Au.abstract: Generates a Lens for the field indicated by its key path.

Protocols/AutoGetter.html#/s:9BowOptics1.name: getter(for:)
Protocols/AutoGetter.html#/s:9BowOptics1.abstract: Generates a Getter for the field given by the key path.

Protocols/AutoFold.html#/s:9BowOptics8Au.name: fold(for:)
Protocols/AutoFold.html#/s:9BowOptics8Au.abstract: Provides a Fold focused on the items of the field given by a key path.

Protocols/AutoFold.html#/s:9BowOptics8Au.name: fold(for:)
Protocols/AutoFold.html#/s:9BowOptics8Au.abstract: Provides a Fold focused on the items of the field given by a key path.

Protocols/AutoFold.html#/s:9BowOptics8Au.name: fold(for:)
Protocols/AutoFold.html#/s:9BowOptics8Au.abstract: Provides a Fold focused on the items of a Foldable field given by a key path.

Protocols/AutoAffineTraversal.html#/s:9B.name: affineTraversal(for:)
Protocols/AutoAffineTraversal.html#/s:9B.abstract: Generates an AffineTraversal optic that focuses on a nilable field.

Protocols/AutoAffineTraversal.html#/s:9B.name: affineTraversal(for:)
Protocols/AutoAffineTraversal.html#/s:9B.abstract: Generates an AffineTraversal optic that focuses on an Option field.

Protocols/AutoAffineTraversal.html.name: AutoAffineTraversal
Protocols/AutoAffineTraversal.html.abstract: Protocol for automatic derivation of AffineTraversal optics.

Protocols/AutoGetter.html.name: AutoGetter
Protocols/AutoGetter.html.abstract: Protocol for automatic derivation of Getter optics

Protocols/AutoPrism.html.name: AutoPrism
Protocols/AutoPrism.html.abstract: Protocol for automatic derivation of Prism optics.

Protocols/At.html.name: At
Protocols/At.html.abstract: At provides a Lens for a this structure to focus at AtFoci at a given index AtIndex.

Protocols/Cons.html.name: Cons
Protocols/Cons.html.abstract: Cons provides a Prism between this structure and a pair containing its first element and its tail. It provides a convenient way to attach or detach elements to the left side of a structure.

Protocols/Each.html.name: Each
Protocols/Each.html.abstract: Each provides a Traversal that can focus into this structure to see all its foci of type EachFoci.

Protocols/FilterIndex.html.name: FilterIndex
Protocols/FilterIndex.html.abstract: FilterIndex provides a Traversal for this structure with all its foci FilterIndexFoci whose index FilterIndexType satisfies a predicate.

Protocols/Index.html.name: Index
Protocols/Index.html.abstract: Index provides an AffineTraversal for this structure to focus on an optional IndexFoci at a given index IndexType.

Protocols/Snoc.html.name: Snoc
Protocols/Snoc.html.abstract: Snoc defines a Prism between this structure and its init (all elements but the last one) and last elements. It can be seen as the reverse of Cons. It provides a way to attach or detach elements on the end side of a structure.

Protocols/Functor.html.name: Functor
Protocols/Functor.html.abstract: A Functor provides a type with the ability to transform its value type into another type, while preserving its structure.

Protocols/Async.html.name: Async
Protocols/Async.html.abstract: Async models how a data type runs an asynchronous computation that may fail, described by the Proc signature.

Protocols/Bracket.html.name: Bracket
Protocols/Bracket.html.abstract: Bracket models a generalized abstracted pattern of safe resource acquisition and release in the face of errors or interruptions.

Protocols/Concurrent.html.name: Concurrent
Protocols/Concurrent.html.abstract: Concurrent describes asynchronous operations that can be started concurrently.

Protocols/ConcurrentEffect.html.name: ConcurrentEffect
Protocols/ConcurrentEffect.html.abstract: ConcurrentEffect describes computations that can be cancelled and evaluated concurrently.

Protocols/Traverse.html.name: Traverse
Protocols/Traverse.html.abstract: Traverse provides a type with the ability to traverse a structure with an effect.

Protocols/Effect.html.name: Effect
Protocols/Effect.html.abstract: Effect is a Monad that can suspend side effects into the context implementing it and supports lazy and potentially asynchronous evaluation.

Protocols/MonadDefer.html.name: MonadDefer
Protocols/MonadDefer.html.abstract: MonadDefer is a Monad that provides the ability to delay the evaluation of a computation.

Protocols/UnsafeRun.html.name: UnsafeRun
Protocols/UnsafeRun.html.abstract: UsafeRun provides capabilities to run a computation unsafely, synchronous or asynchronously.

Protocols/Comonad.html.name: Comonad
Protocols/Comonad.html.abstract: A Comonad is the dual of a Monad. It provides capabilities to compose functions that extract values from their context.

Protocols/Applicative.html.name: Applicative
Protocols/Applicative.html.abstract: An Applicative Functor is a Functor that also provides functionality to lift pure expressions, and sequence computations and combine their results.

Protocols/ApplicativeError.html.name: ApplicativeError
Protocols/ApplicativeError.html.abstract: An ApplicativeError is an Applicative that has capabilities to raise and handle error values.

Protocols.html#/s:3Bow7BimonadP.name: Bimonad
Protocols.html#/s:3Bow7BimonadP.abstract: A Bimonad has the same capabilities as Monad and Comonad.

Protocols/ComonadEnv.html.name: ComonadEnv
Protocols/ComonadEnv.html.abstract: The ComonadEnv type class represents a Comonad that support a global environment that can be provided and transformed into a local environment.

Protocols/ComonadStore.html.name: ComonadStore
Protocols/ComonadStore.html.abstract: The ComonadStore type class represents those Comonads that support local position information.

Protocols/ComonadTraced.html.name: ComonadTraced
Protocols/ComonadTraced.html.abstract: The ComonadTraced type class represents those comonads which support relative (monoidal) position information.

Protocols/ComonadTrans.html.name: ComonadTrans
Protocols/ComonadTrans.html.abstract: The ComonadTrans type class represents Comonad Transformers.

Protocols/Contravariant.html.name: Contravariant
Protocols/Contravariant.html.abstract: A Contravariant Functor is the dual of a Covariant Functor, usually referred to as just Functor. Whereas an intuition behind Covariant Functors is that they can be seen as containing or producing values, Contravariant Functors can be seen as consuming values.

Protocols/Decidable.html.name: Decidable
Protocols/Decidable.html.abstract: Decidable is a typeclass modeling contravariant decision. Decidable is the contravariant version of Alternative.

Protocols/Divide.html.name: Divide
Protocols/Divide.html.abstract: Divide is a type class that models the divide part of divide and conquer.

Protocols/Divisible.html.name: Divisible
Protocols/Divisible.html.abstract: Divisible extends Divide by providing an empty value.

Protocols/EquatableK.html.name: EquatableK
Protocols/EquatableK.html.abstract: EquatableK provides capabilities to check equality of values at the kind level.

Protocols/Foldable.html.name: Foldable
Protocols/Foldable.html.abstract: Foldable describes types that have the ability to be folded to a summary value.

Protocols/FunctorFilter.html.name: FunctorFilter
Protocols/FunctorFilter.html.abstract: A FunctorFilter provides the same capabilities as a Functor, while filtering out elements simultaneously.

Protocols/HashableK.html.name: HashableK
Protocols/HashableK.html.abstract: EquatableK provides capabilities to compute a hash value at the kind level.

Protocols/Invariant.html.name: Invariant
Protocols/Invariant.html.abstract: An Invariant Functor provides a type the ability to transform its value type into another type. An instance of Functor or Contravariant are Invariant Functors as well.

Protocols/Monad.html.name: Monad
Protocols/Monad.html.abstract: A Monad provides functionality to sequence operations that are dependent from one another.

Protocols/MonadCombine.html.name: MonadCombine
Protocols/MonadCombine.html.abstract: A MonadCombine has the capabilities of MonadFilter and Alternative together.

Protocols/MonadError.html.name: MonadError
Protocols/MonadError.html.abstract: A MonadError has the same capabilities as a Monad and an ApplicativeError.

Protocols/MonadFilter.html.name: MonadFilter
Protocols/MonadFilter.html.abstract: A MonadFilter is a Monad with FunctorFilter capabilities. It also provides functionality to create a value that represents an empty element in the context implementing an instance of this typeclass.

Protocols/MonadReader.html.name: MonadReader
Protocols/MonadReader.html.abstract: A MonadReader is a Monad with capabilities to read values from a shared environment.

Protocols/MonadState.html.name: MonadState
Protocols/MonadState.html.abstract: A MonadState is a Monad that maintains a state.

Protocols/MonadTrans.html.name: MonadTrans
Protocols/MonadTrans.html.abstract: A monad transformer makes a new monad out of an existing monad, such that computations of the old monad may be embedded in the new one.

Protocols/MonadWriter.html.name: MonadWriter
Protocols/MonadWriter.html.abstract: A MonadWriter is a Monad with the ability to produce a stream of data in addition to the computed values.

Protocols/Monoid.html.name: Monoid
Protocols/Monoid.html.abstract: A monoid is an algebraic structure that has the same properties as a semigroup, with an empty element.

Protocols/MonoidK.html.name: MonoidK
Protocols/MonoidK.html.abstract: A MonoidK is a SemigroupK that also has an empty element.

Protocols/Monoidal.html.name: Monoidal
Protocols/Monoidal.html.abstract: The Monoidal type class adds an identity element to Semigroupal type class by defining the function identity.

Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html.name: NonEmptyReducible
Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html.abstract: NonEmptyReducible defines a Reducible in terms of another type that has an instance of Foldable and a method that is able to split a structure of values in a first value and the rest of the values in the structure.

Protocols/Reducible.html.name: Reducible
Protocols/Reducible.html.abstract: Reducible augments the functions provided by Foldable with reducing functions that do not need an initial value.

Protocols/Selective.html.name: Selective
Protocols/Selective.html.abstract: The Selective typeclass represents Selective Applicative Functors, described in this paper. Selective Applicative Functors enrich Applicative Functors by providing an operation that composes two effectful computations where the second depends on the first.

Protocols/Semigroup.html.name: Semigroup
Protocols/Semigroup.html.abstract: A semigroup is an algebraic structure that consists of a set of values and an associative operation.

Protocols/SemigroupK.html.name: SemigroupK
Protocols/SemigroupK.html.abstract: SemigroupK is a Semigroup that operates on kinds with one type parameter.

Protocols/Semigroupal.html.name: Semigroupal
Protocols/Semigroupal.html.abstract: The Semigroupal type class for a given type F can be seen as an abstraction over the cartesian product.

Protocols/Semiring.html.name: Semiring
Protocols/Semiring.html.abstract: A semiring is an algebraic structure that has the same properties as a commutative monoid for addition, with multiplication.

Protocols/TraverseFilter.html.name: TraverseFilter
Protocols/TraverseFilter.html.abstract: TraverseFilter represents array-like structures that can be traversed and filtered as a single combined operation. It provides the same capabilities as Traverse and FunctorFilter together.

Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects10continue.name: continueOn(_:)
Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects10continue.abstract: Shiftes the execution to a given queue.

Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.name: parallel(_:_:)
Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.abstract: Runs 2 computations in parallel and tuples their results.

Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.name: parallel(_:_:_:)
Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.abstract: Runs 3 computations in parallel and tuples their results.

Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.name: parallel(_:_:_:_:)
Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.abstract: Runs 4 computations in parallel and tuples their results.

Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.name: parallel(_:_:_:_:_:)
Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.abstract: Runs 5 computations in parallel and tuples their results.

Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.name: parallel(_:_:_:_:_:_:)
Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.abstract: Runs 6 computations in parallel and tuples their results.

Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.name: parallel(_:_:_:_:_:_:_:)
Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.abstract: Runs 7 computations in parallel and tuples their results.

Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.name: parallel(_:_:_:_:_:_:_:_:)
Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.abstract: Runs 8 computations in parallel and tuples their results.

Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.name: parallel(_:_:_:_:_:_:_:_:_:)
Functions.html#/s:10BowEffects8parallely.abstract: Runs 9 computations in parallel and tuples their results.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbycS.name: complement(_:)
Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbycS.abstract: Given a 0-ary function, provides a 0-ary function that returns the complement boolean value.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbxcS.name: complement(_:)
Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbxcS.abstract: Given a 1-ary function, provides a 1-ary function that returns the complement boolean value.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.name: complement(_:)
Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.abstract: Given a 2-ary function, provides a 2-ary function that returns the complement boolean value.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.name: complement(_:)
Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.abstract: Given a 3-ary function, provides a 3-ary function that returns the complement boolean value.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.name: complement(_:)
Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.abstract: Given a 4-ary function, provides a 4-ary function that returns the complement boolean value.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.name: complement(_:)
Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.abstract: Given a 5-ary function, provides a 5-ary function that returns the complement boolean value.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.name: complement(_:)
Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.abstract: Given a 6-ary function, provides a 6-ary function that returns the complement boolean value.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.name: complement(_:)
Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.abstract: Given a 7-ary function, provides a 7-ary function that returns the complement boolean value.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.name: complement(_:)
Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.abstract: Given a 8-ary function, provides a 8-ary function that returns the complement boolean value.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.name: complement(_:)
Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.abstract: Given a 9-ary function, provides a 9-ary function that returns the complement boolean value.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.name: complement(_:)
Functions.html#/s:3Bow10complementySbx_q.abstract: Given a 10-ary function, provides a 10-ary function that returns the complement boolean value.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow2ogoiyq0_q_cx_q0_x.abstract: Applies the first argument to a 2-ary function, returning a 1-ary function with the rest of the arguments of the original function.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow2ogoiyq1_q__q0_tcx.abstract: Applies the first argument to a 3-ary function, returning a 2-ary function with the rest of the arguments of the original function.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow2ogoiyq2_q__q0_q1_.abstract: Applies the first argument to a 4-ary function, returning a 3-ary function with the rest of the arguments of the original function.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow2ogoiyq3_q__q0_q1_.abstract: Applies the first argument to a 5-ary function, returning a 4-ary function with the rest of the arguments of the original function.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow2ogoiyq4_q__q0_q1_.abstract: Applies the first argument to a 6-ary function, returning a 5-ary function with the rest of the arguments of the original function.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow2ogoiyq5_q__q0_q1_.abstract: Applies the first argument to a 7-ary function, returning a 6-ary function with the rest of the arguments of the original function.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow2ogoiyq6_q__q0_q1_.abstract: Applies the first argument to a 8-ary function, returning a 7-ary function with the rest of the arguments of the original function.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow4flipyq0_q__xtcq0_.name: flip(_:)
Functions.html#/s:3Bow4flipyq0_q__xtcq0_.abstract: Flips the arguments of a binary function.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow3olsopyAA17Binding.abstract: Creates a binding expression that discards the produced value.

Functions.html#/s:3Bow3askAA4KindCyx1DQz.name: ask()
Functions.html#/s:3Bow3askAA4KindCyx1DQz.abstract: Utility alias for MonadReader.ask in a monad comprehension.

Extensions/Puller.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A9F.name: moveLeft()
Extensions/Puller.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A9F.abstract: Creates a Puller that can move a Zipper focus to the left.

Extensions/Puller.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A9F.name: moveRight()
Extensions/Puller.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A9F.abstract: Creates a Puller that can move a Zipper focus to the right.

Extensions/Puller.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A9F.name: moveToFirst()
Extensions/Puller.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A9F.abstract: Creates a Puller that can move a Zipper focus to the leftmost position.

Extensions/Puller.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A9F.name: moveToLast()
Extensions/Puller.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A9F.abstract: Creates a Puller that can move a Zipper focus to the rightmost position.

Extensions/BidirectionalCollection.html#.name: firstOrNone
Extensions/BidirectionalCollection.html#.abstract: Obtains the first element of this bidirectional collection or Option.none.

Extensions/BidirectionalCollection.html#.name: firstOrNone(_:)
Extensions/BidirectionalCollection.html#.abstract: Obtains the first element of this bidirectional collection that matches a predicate.

Extensions/BidirectionalCollection.html#.name: lastOrNone
Extensions/BidirectionalCollection.html#.abstract: Obtains the last element of this bidirectional collection or Option.none.

Extensions/BidirectionalCollection.html#.name: lastOrNone(_:)
Extensions/BidirectionalCollection.html#.abstract: Obtains the last element of this bidirectional collection that matches a predicate.

Extensions/BidirectionalCollection.html#.name: singleOrNone
Extensions/BidirectionalCollection.html#.abstract: Returns an element if it is the single one in this collection or Option.none

Extensions/BidirectionalCollection.html#.name: singleOrNone(_:)
Extensions/BidirectionalCollection.html#.abstract: Returns an element if it is the single one matching a predicate.

Extensions/Sequence.html#/s:ST3BowE11fir.name: firstOrNone
Extensions/Sequence.html#/s:ST3BowE11fir.abstract: Obtains the first element of this sequence or Option.none.

Extensions/Sequence.html#/s:ST3BowE11fir.name: firstOrNone(_:)
Extensions/Sequence.html#/s:ST3BowE11fir.abstract: Obtains the first element of this sequence that matches a predicate.

Extensions/Collection.html#/s:Sl3BowE11f.name: firstOrNone
Extensions/Collection.html#/s:Sl3BowE11f.abstract: Obtains the first element of this collection or Option.none.

Extensions/Collection.html#/s:Sl3BowE11f.name: firstOrNone(_:)
Extensions/Collection.html#/s:Sl3BowE11f.abstract: Obtains the first element of this collection that matches a predicate.

Extensions/Collection.html#/s:Sl3BowE12s.name: singleOrNone
Extensions/Collection.html#/s:Sl3BowE12s.abstract: Returns an element if it is the single one in this collection or Option.none

Extensions/Collection.html#/s:Sl3BowE12s.name: singleOrNone(_:)
Extensions/Collection.html#/s:Sl3BowE12s.abstract: Returns an element if it is the single one matching a predicate.

Extensions/Optional.html#/s:Sq3BowE14rig.name: rightIfNotNull(_:)
Extensions/Optional.html#/s:Sq3BowE14rig.abstract: Converts this optional to an Either.right value, providing a default value if it is nil.

Extensions/CoSumOpt.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A.name: hide()
Extensions/CoSumOpt.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A.abstract: Creates a CoSumOpt that can select the hidden side of a SumOpt.

Extensions/CoSumOpt.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A.name: show()
Extensions/CoSumOpt.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A.abstract: Creates a CoSumOpt that can select the visible side of a SumOpt.

Extensions/CoSumOpt.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A.name: toggle()
Extensions/CoSumOpt.html#/s:3Bow3CoTCA2A.abstract: Creates a CoSumOpt that can toggle the side of a SumOpt.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: and(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Composes this schedule with another one, providing a new schedule that continues as long as both continue, using the maximum delay of the two schedules.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: split(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Composes this schedule with another one, providing a new schedule that needs the input of both schedules and provides the output of both. It continues as long as both continue, using the maximum delay of the two schedules.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: choose(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Chooses between two schedules with different inputs and outputs.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: choose(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Chooses between two schedules with different inputs and the same output.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: zip(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Composes this schedule with another one, providing a new schedule that continues as long as both continue, using the maximum delay of the two schedules.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: zipRight(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Composes this schedule with another one, providing a new schedule that continues as long as both continue, using the maximum delay of the two schedules, and ignoring the output of this schedule.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: zipLeft(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Composes this schedule with another one, providing a new schedule that continues as long as both continue, using the maximum delay of the two schedules, and ignoring the output of the provided schedule.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: pipe(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Pipes the output of this schedule as the input of the provided one. Effects described by this schedule will always be performed before the effects described by the second schedule.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: reversePipe(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Pipes the output of the provided schedule as the input of this schedule. Effects described by the provided schedule will always be performed before the effects described by this schedule.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: or(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Composes with a schedule resulting in another one that continues as long as either schedule continues, using the minimum of the delays of the two schedules.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: addDelay(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Adds a delay of the specified duration based on the output of this schedule.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: addDelayM(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Adds a delay of the specified duration based on the output of this schedule.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: addDelay(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Adds a delay of the specified duration based on the output of this schedule.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: addDelayM(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Adds a delay of the specified duration based on the output of this schedule.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: andThen(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Composes two schedules with the same input and output by applying them sequentially. It executes the first to completion, and then executes the second.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: andThenEither(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Composes two schedules with the same input but different outputs by applying them sequentially. It executes the first to completion, and then executes the second.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: as(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Transforms the output of this schedule to a fixed value.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: both(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Composes this schedule with another one, providing a new schedule that continues as long as both continue, using the maximum delay of the two schedules.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: bothWith(_:_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Composes this schedule with another one, providing a new schedule that continues as long as both continue, using the maximum delay of the two schedules, and combining the outputs of both using the provided function.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: check(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Peeks at the output produced by this schedule and executes a test to determine if the schedule should continue or not.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: collectAll()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Collects all the output of this schedule in an array.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: compose(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Pipes the output of the provided schedule as the input of this schedule. Effects described by the provided schedule will always be performed before the effects described by this schedule.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: contramap(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides an schedule that deals with a narrower class of inputs than this schedule.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: dimap(_:_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides an schedule that contramaps the input and maps the output with the provided functions.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: either(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Composes with a schedule resulting in another one that continues as long as either schedule continues, using the minimum of the delays of the two schedules.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: eitherWith(_:_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Composes with a schedule resulting in another one that continues as long as either schedule continues, using the minimum of the delays of the two schedules, and transforming the outputs with the provided function.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: first()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Puts this schedule into the first element of a tuple and passes an unmodified element as the second element of the tuple.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: fold(_:_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that folds the outputs of this one.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: forever()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Returns a new schedule that loops this one forever, resetting the state when this schedule is completed.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: initialized(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Returns a new schedule with the specified initial state transformed by a function.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: left()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Puts the schedule into the left side of an Either and passes an unmodified value as the right side of the Either.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: map(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Transforms the output of this schedule with the provided function.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: repetitions()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a new schedule that emits the number of repetitions of this schedule.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: right()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Puts the schedule into the right side of an Either and passes an unmodified value as the left side of the Either.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: second()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Puts this schedule into the second element of a tuple and passes an unmodified element as the first element of the tuple.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: tapInput(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Performs an additional effect for every input.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: tapOutput(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Performs an additional effect for every output.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: void()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Wipes out the output produced by this schedule.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: untilInput(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that iterates this schedule until the input matches a given predicate.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: untilInputM(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that iterates this schedule until the input matches a given effectful predicate.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: untilOutput(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that iterates this schedule until the output matches a given predicate.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: untilOutputM(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that iterates this schedule until the output matches a given effectful predicate.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: whileInput(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that iterates this schedule while the input matches a given predicate.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: whileInputM(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that iterates this schedule while the input matches a given effectful predicate.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: whileOutput(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that iterates this schedule while the output matches a given predicate.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: whileOutputM(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that iterates this schedule while the output matches a given effectful predicate.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: unfold(_:_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that always recurs without delay and computes the output through subsequent applications of a function to an initial value.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: unfoldM(_:_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that always recurs without delay and computes the output through subsequent applications of an effectful function to an initial value.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: delayed(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule from the given schedule which transforms the delays into effectufl sleeps.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: delayed(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule from the given schedule which transforms the delays into effectufl sleeps.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: elapsed()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs forever without a delay, returning the elapsed time since it began.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: duration(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs until the specified duration elapsed, returning the total elapsed time.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: spaced(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that waits for the specified amount of time between each input. Returns the number of received inputs.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: spaced(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that waits for the specified amount of time between each input. Returns the number of received inputs.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: exponential(_:factor:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that always recurs, waiting an amount of time between repetitions, given by an exponential backoff algorithm, and returning the current duration between recurrences.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: exponential(_:factor:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that always recurs, waiting an amount of time between repetitions, given by an exponential backoff algorithm, and returning the current duration between recurrences.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: linear(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that always recurs, waiting an amount of time between repetitions, given by a linear backoff algorithm, and returning the current duration between recurrences.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: linear(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that always recurs, waiting an amount of time between repetitions, given by a linear backoff algorithm, and returning the current duration between recurrences.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: fibonacci(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that always recurs, increasing delays by summing the preceding two delays, as in the Fibonacci sequence. Returns the current duration between recurrences.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: fibonacci(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that always recurs, increasing delays by summing the preceding two delays, as in the Fibonacci sequence. Returns the current duration between recurrences.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: void()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that wipes out the output.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: identity()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that returns the input, unmodified.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: doWhile(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs as long as the predicate evaluates to true.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: doWhileM(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs as long as the effectful predicate evaluates to true.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: doUntil(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs until the predicate evaluates to true.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: doUntilM(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs until the effectful predicate evaluates to true.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: tapInput(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that executes an effect for every consumed input.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: tapOutput(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that executes an effect for every produced output.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: from(function:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs forever, mapping input values through the provided function.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: doWhileEquals(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs as long as the input is equal to a specific value.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: doUntilEquals(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs as long as the input is not equal to a specific value.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: forever()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that runs forever and emits the number of iterations it has performed.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: recurs(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs a specific number of times, emitting the current iteration it is in.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: once()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs only once.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: stop()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs zero times.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: never()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that never recurs.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: collectAll()
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that recurs forever and collects all its outputs in an array.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: collectWhile(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that collects its outputs in an array as long as the outputs match a given predicate.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: collectWhileM(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that collects its outputs in an array as long as the outputs match a given effectful predicate.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: collectUntil(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that collects its outputs in an array until an output matches a given predicate.

Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.name: collectUntilM(_:)
Classes/Schedule.html#/s:10BowEffects8Sc.abstract: Provides a schedule that collects its outputs in an array until an output matches a given effectful predicate.

Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC3ge.name: get()
Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC3ge.abstract: Obtains the current value. Since Ref is always guaranteed to have a value, the returned action completes immetiately after being bound.

Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC3se.name: set(_:)
Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC3se.abstract: Sets the current value to a new value. The returned action completes after the reference has been successfully set.

Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC9ge.name: getAndSet(_:)
Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC9ge.abstract: Replaces the current value, returning the old value.

Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC9se.name: setAndGet(_:)
Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC9se.abstract: Replaces the current value, returning the new value.

Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC6up.name: update(_:)
Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC6up.abstract: Updates the current value with a function. If another modification occurs between the time the current value is read and subsequently updated, the modification is retried using the new value. Hence, the function may be invoked multiple times.

Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC12g.name: getAndUpdate(_:)
Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC12g.abstract: Modifies the current value using the supplied update function and returns the old value.

Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC12u.name: updateAndGet(_:)
Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC12u.abstract: Modifies the current value using the supplied update function and returns the new value.

Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC6mo.name: modify(_:)
Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC6mo.abstract: Updates the reference but allows the function to return an output of a different type.

Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC9tr.name: tryUpdate(_:)
Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC9tr.abstract: Tries to modify the current value once, in contrast to update which calls the function until it succeeds.

Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC9tr.name: tryModify(_:)
Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC9tr.abstract: Tries to modify the current value once, in contrast to modify which calls the function until it succeeds.

Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC6ac.name: access()
Classes/Ref.html#/s:10BowEffects3RefC6ac.abstract: Obtains a snapshot of the current value and a setter for updating it. The setter will return false if another concurrent call invalidated the snapshot; i.e. modified the value. It will return true if setting the value was successful. Once it has returned false or been used once, a setter never succeeds again.

Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC3env0.name: env()
Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC3env0.abstract: Creates an EnvIO with no dependencies from this IO.

Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC6invo.name: invoke(_:)
Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC6invo.abstract: Creates an IO from a side-effectful function.

Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC12inv.name: invokeEither(_:)
Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC12inv.abstract: Creates an IO from a side-effectful function.

Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC12inv.name: invokeResult(_:)

Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC15inv.name: invokeValidated(_:)
Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC15inv.abstract: Creates an IO from a side-effectful function.

Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC5merg.name: merge(_:_:_:_:_:)
Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC5merg.abstract: Creates an IO from 5 side-effectful functions, tupling their results. Errors thrown from the functions must be of type E; otherwise, a fatal error will happen.

Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC5merg.name: merge(_:_:_:_:_:_:)
Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC5merg.abstract: Creates an IO from 6 side-effectful functions, tupling their results. Errors thrown from the functions must be of type E; otherwise, a fatal error will happen.

Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC5merg.name: merge(_:_:_:_:_:_:_:)
Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC5merg.abstract: Creates an IO from 7 side-effectful functions, tupling their results. Errors thrown from the functions must be of type E; otherwise, a fatal error will happen.

Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC5merg.name: merge(_:_:_:_:_:_:_:_:)
Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC5merg.abstract: Creates an IO from 8 side-effectful functions, tupling their results. Errors thrown from the functions must be of type E; otherwise, a fatal error will happen.

Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC5merg.name: merge(_:_:_:_:_:_:_:_:_:)
Classes/IO.html#/s:10BowEffects2IOC5merg.abstract: Creates an IO from 9 side-effectful functions, tupling their results. Errors thrown from the functions must be of type E; otherwise, a fatal error will happen.

Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.name: init(_:)
Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.abstract: Initializes an atomic value with an initial value.

Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.name: value
Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.abstract: Gets or sets the underlying value in a thread-safe manner.

Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.name: mutate(_:)
Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.abstract: Mutates the underlying value using the provided function.

Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.name: getAndSet(_:)
Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.abstract: Gets the underlying value and sets a new value.

Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.name: getAndUpdate(_:)
Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.abstract: Gets the underlying value and sets a new value transforming it with a function.

Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.name: setAndGet(_:)
Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.abstract: Sets a new value in this atomic reference and gets the newly updated value.

Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.name: updateAndGet(_:)
Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.abstract: Sets a new value transforming the underlying one using a function and gets the new value.

Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.name: setIfNil(_:)
Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.abstract: Sets a new value if the underlying value is nil

Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.name: compare(_:andSet:)
Classes/Atomic.html#/s:10BowEffects6Atom.abstract: Sets a new value if the underlying value is equal to the one passed as a test.

Classes/Program.html#/s:7BowFree7Program.name: liftF(_:)
Classes/Program.html#/s:7BowFree7Program.abstract: Lifts a value in the context of F into the Program context.

Classes/Program.html#/s:7BowFree7Program.name: foldMapK(_:)
Classes/Program.html#/s:7BowFree7Program.abstract: Interprets this Program value into the provided Monad.

Classes/Program.html#/s:7BowFree7Program.name: run()
Classes/Program.html#/s:7BowFree7Program.abstract: Folds this program structure using the same Monad.

Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.name: free()
Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.abstract: Obtains a natural transformation for the Free Monads of the Functors from this natural transformation.

Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.name: monad()
Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.abstract: Obtains a natural transformation from a Free Monad to the underlying Monad.

Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.name: interpreter()
Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.abstract: Obtains an interpreter for Free Monads from this Natural Transformation.

Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.name: left()
Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.abstract: Obtains a natural transformation from a Free Monad to another one that sums two Functors, placing the underlying functor on the left-hand side of the sum.

Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.name: right()
Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.abstract: Obtains a natural transformation from a Free Monad to another one that sums two Functors, placing the underlying functor on the right-hand side of the sum.

Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.name: transformAndReduce
Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.abstract: Obtains a natural transformation that reduces a coyoneda value of a type constructor F

Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.name: sum(_:)
Classes/FunctionK.html#/s:3Bow9FunctionK.abstract: Combines this natural transformation with another one targetting the same Functor.

Classes/Free.html#/s:7BowFree0B0C5liftFy.name: liftF(_:)
Classes/Free.html#/s:7BowFree0B0C5liftFy.abstract: Lifts a value in the context of the Functor into the Free context.

Classes/Free.html#/s:7BowFree0B0C8foldMa.name: foldMapK(_:)
Classes/Free.html#/s:7BowFree0B0C8foldMa.abstract: Interprets this Free value into the provided Monad.

Classes/Free.html#/s:7BowFree0B0CAA0A05M.name: run()
Classes/Free.html#/s:7BowFree0B0CAA0A05M.abstract: Folds this free structure using the same Monad.

Classes/Cofree.html#/s:7BowFree6CofreeC4.name: tail
Classes/Cofree.html#/s:7BowFree6CofreeC4.abstract: A potentially lazy way of obtaining further values in this comonadic structure.

Classes/Cofree.html#/s:7BowFree6CofreeC1.name: tailForced()
Classes/Cofree.html#/s:7BowFree6CofreeC1.abstract: Obtains the values in the context of this Cofree comonad.

Classes/Cofree.html#/s:7BowFree6CofreeC6.name: unfold(_:_:)
Classes/Cofree.html#/s:7BowFree6CofreeC6.abstract: Constructs a Cofree from a seed and an unfolding function.

Classes/Cofree.html#/s:7BowFree6CofreeC6.name: create(_:_:)
Classes/Cofree.html#/s:7BowFree6CofreeC6.abstract: Constructs a Cofree from a seed and an unfolding function.

Classes/Cofree.html#/s:7BowFree6CofreeCA.name: cata(_:)
Classes/Cofree.html#/s:7BowFree6CofreeCA.abstract: Folds this structure into a single value.

Classes/Cofree.html#/s:7BowFree6CofreeCA.name: cataM(_:_:)
Classes/Cofree.html#/s:7BowFree6CofreeCA.abstract: Folds this structure into a monadic value.
